name: Association of Latino Professionals For America
description: The specific purpose of this organization are to unite Latino professionals practicing in the United States, to provide professional networking opportunities for such professionals, and to advance their professional education goals. To promote and maintain high professional standards for Latino professionals. To promote mentoring and professional development relationships and opportunities among Latino professionals practicing in the United States. The organization shall not, except to an insubstantial degree, engage in any activities or exercise any powers that are not in furtherance of the specific purposes described above. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: 'Esak'tima Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: 2D Animation Club
description: The purpose of this organization is for students (open to non-students) that would like to learn, collaborate, and create on all things 2D animation

name: A Cappella Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote and nurture a cappella music of the past and present through our own C-Sus Voices ensemble.

name: Accounting Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide members: A) a better understanding of the accounting and finance profession and B) a place to network with peers and mentors interested in the accounting and finance fields.

name: Admissions & Outreach
description: Membership Benefits

name: Afghan Students Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote, embrace and celebrate Afghan culture through raising awareness, promoting social events, as well as fundraising. -Help the impoverished communities in Afghanistan through our efforts of raising money, clothing, and school supplies. -Social events to build connections amongst our Afghan students attending CSUS

name: African American Male Education Network & Development
description: The purpose of A2MEND Student Charter is to promote the enhancement of enrollment, success, empowerment, leadership, networking, professionalism, and graduation of individuals included but not limited to African American, Latino, and other students at California State University, Sacramento.

name: All Of Us Or None
description: All of Us or None is a grassroots civil and human rights organization dedicated to fighting against discrimination based on arrest and conviction histories. We advocate for the rights and dignity of formerly and currently incarcerated individuals and their families, working to dismantle systemic injustices and promote equitable treatment.

name: Allied Students for Justice
description: Allied Students for Justice (ASFJ) is an inclusive platform designed to empower students and promote social justice at California State University, Sacramento (CSUS). ASFJ's platform aims to inspire, educate, and mobilize individuals towards creating a more equitable and inclusive society. By fostering dialogue, organizing events, and providing resources, ASFJ encourages students to become active advocates for social justice on and off campus.

name: Alpha Chi Omega
description: The purpose of Alpha Chi Omega Fraternity (the National Fraternity), as stated in The Heritage of Alpha Chi Omega Fraternity, is to encourage the spirit of true sisterhood, to develop through personal effort a high moral and mental standard, and to advance the appreciation and practice of the fine arts among its members. Alpha Chi Omega is a women's organization dedicated to empowering real, strong women to reach their potential through a lifelong experience of sisterhood, service and leadership development. This is a place where real, strong women find connection, a community of support and opportunities to grow among those who encourage them to chase their passions and value them for who they really are and want to become.

name: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated
description: The purpose of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated is to cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help alleviate problems concerning girls and women in order to improve their social stature, to maintain a progressive interest in college life, and to be of service to all mankind.

name: alpha Kappa Delta Phi
description: MISSION STATEMENT alpha Kappa Delta Phi Sorority, Inc. fosters the making of successful leaders by assisting and challenging our members to reach their maximum potential. We strive to maintain the highest levels of integrity and innovation in the promotion of sisterhood, philanthropy, scholastic excellence, and Asian-Awareness in the community while creating lifelong relationships. VISION STATEMENT alpha Kappa Delta Phi Inc. will be the most respected, premier network of innovative female leaders within the community by encouraging the growth of our members through cultural diversity and the expression of individuality; Empowering our members to become pioneers for philanthropic, cultural, and scholastic programs worldwide; Developing strategic collaborations and partnerships; and Supporting initiatives promoting the sustainability of our organization and its mission.

name: Alpha Phi
description: The purpose of this chapter is the promotion of growth in character, of unity of feeling, of sisterly affection and of social communion among its members. And we who are thus united are under a solemn pledge to lend a helping hand to one another.

name: Alpha Phi Omega
description: The purpose of Alpha Phi Omega shall be to assemble college students in a National Service Fraternity in the fellowship of principles derived from the Scout Oath and Scout Law of the Boy Scouts of America; to develop Leadership, to promote Friendship, and to provide Service to humanity; and to further the freedom that is our national, educational, and intellectual heritage.

name: Alpha Phi Sigma Criminal Justice Honor Society
description: The purpose of Alpha Phi Sigma is to recognize and promote academic excellence among students pursuing a baccalaureate or graduate degree in Criminal Justice, or a related field at California State University, Sacramento.

name: Alpha Psi Lambda
description: Alpha Psi Lambda was founded in 1985 at the Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio.Â We areÂ a Co-educational Fraternity geared towards the goals of Latino students on university campuses.Â While we are a Latino interest Fraternity, Alpha Psi Lambda has welcomed people from a broad spectrum of cultures across the globe.Â Alpha Psi Lambda stands as one family united.Â Our strength lies in our ability to focus on our culture while appreciating the diversity of others.Â The Latino culture is very strongly rooted in family and support, which allows Alpha Psi Lambda to provide those same roots to our Fraternity. Alpha Psi Lambda, to its members, is more than just a Fraternity. It creates that true family support, brotherhood and sisterhood, at a time in a student's life when it is most important.Â Our membership prides itself on the values ofÂ Familia, Culture, Academics, Service and Leadership.

name: American Association of Men in Nursing
description: The purpose of this organization is to encourage people of all ages to consider nursing as a profession via an increase community outreach, distribution of educational materials, and to demonstrate contributions being made by men in the nursing profession.

name: American Concrete Institute
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide concrete design knowledge and resources and to bridge the gap between students and industry professionals.

name: American Institute of Architecture Students
description: The aim of this organization is to offer assistance and tools to foster individual growth and help establish connections between AIAS Chapter members and the broader Sacramento Design Community, facilitated by its affiliation with AIAS, Central Valley AIA, and AIA.Â

name: American Sign Language Club
description: To empower those who are interested in American Sign Language and Deaf Culture by promoting the use of ASL and involvement in the Deaf community through: activism along with awareness of cultural issues and practices within the greater Sacramento area and all ASL users. To provide an environment that encourages students to learn and practice ASL with their peers through meetings and socials.

name: American Society of Civil Engineers
description: We the members of the Student Chapter of the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) at Sac State will foster desirable relations among the Parent Chapters, Student Chapters, Clubs, Alumni, sponsors, student body members and faculty. Furthermore, to further the knowledge of the standards and ethics of the engineering profession, to ordain and establish this constitution as a living document to aid future Sacramento State ASCE members.

name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
description: The purpose of ASME is to promote professional, personal, and academic development of student engineers by providing contact with the industry professionals. Networking and industry interaction will be via facility tours, technology updates, guest speaker events, and participation in industry related events. ASME members will be provided opportunities to interact with fellow engineering students and other student ASME chapters. ASME will promote life-long learning and the development of ethics, civics, and professionalism in all group activities.

name: American Society of Safety Professionals
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote the advancement of the safety profession and education, to support the professional growth of its members on campus and in the community, to advance the members' professional preparation by supporting initiatives that advance safety and the acquisition of technical knowledge, and to promote greater professional and social cooperation and interaction among students of safety and related fields.

name: Anime & Manga Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to serve as a place on the Sacramento State campus that fosters relationships among the Sacramento State community and the community at large through mutual interest in Anime and Manga.

name: Aquatic Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Arab Student Union
description: A club to bring together the Arab community here at Sacramento State to celebrate and enhance our culture and heritage. All who are passionate about the purpose/mission of the organization are welcomed regardless of identity

name: Art History Club
description: The purpose of this organization is The Art History Club is looking to create a space for all majors that want to discuss and are passionate about art. We hope to create academic opportunities for club members to grow and apply their knowledge of art history in professional settings. This will be through community activities (gallery and exhibition shows) and collaborative projects across college campuses.

name: Arts & Letters Joint Council
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a collaborative platform for the students and clubs of the college of Arts & Letters and to extend opportunities for shared governance between students, A&L clubs and organizations, A&L administration, faculty, and staff, and Associated Students, Inc..

name: Asian Pacific Islander Desi American (APIDA) Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Associated General Contractors
description: Organization for both experienced and next-generation construction students through the dedicated profession of AGC, educational, career development, networking opportunities, and the creation of opportunities to build and strengthen the workforce by understanding the current and future policies.

name: Associated Students Inc.
description: Membership Benefits

name: Association for Computing Machinery
description: 1. The Chapter is organized and will be operated exclusively for educational and scientific purposes to promote the following:a. An increased knowledge of and greater interest in the science, design, development, construction, languages, management and applications of modern computing.b. A greater interest in computing and its applications.c. A means of communication between persons having an interest in computing.2. The Chapter will serve students at Sac State and other interested persons in the greater Sacramento, CA community.3. The Chapter is chartered by ACM.

name: Astronomy Club
description: Providing a safe and inclusive place to talk about and practice astronomy, intended for any student who is interested in astronomy.

name: Badminton Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote and encourage participation in the sport of Badminton.

name: Baja Racing SAE
description: The mission of this organization is to design and build a competitive BAJA SAE buggy and to provide hands on learning of product design, development, and engineering, while encouraging personal growth and fostering a supportive educational and social environment.

name: Banda
description: Banda (Los Sonidos Del Estado) is dedicated to celebrating and preserving the vibrant culture of banda music by fostering a welcoming community for students passionate about its traditions. Through education, performance, and collaboration, we aim to enhance musical skills, promote cultural awareness, and connect with our campus and local communities, inspiring appreciation for the rich heritage of banda.

name: Baseball Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a competitive club baseball team that emphasizes teamwork and sportsmanship. We welcome players of all levels to try out, however there is a limited number of roster spots.

name: Bass Fishing
description: The purpose of this organization is to facilitate an environment that produces growth in personal and professional development along with community outreach through the avenue of fishing.

name: Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative
description: The purpose of this club shall be to provide basic healthcare screening and general health/nutrition advice to underserved and neglected communities. To fight heart disease and diabetes among at-risk populations and promote general health knowledge to prevent chronic disease. To promote youth advancement among underserved populations. To promote social justice among our members and in the community. To support and connect with other community organizations that serve our target populations.

name: Billiards Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to facilitate the enjoyment of billiard games for members of the club. This organization provides billiards as a common platform for members to socialize, participate in friendly competition, and interact with other organizations on and off campus.

name: Black Business Student Association
description: To provide a support network for Black, African American, and underrepresented students whose common goal is to achieve success in the business world. This includes offering professional development opportunities, networking events, academic support, and community engagement projects to foster growth and inclusion.

name: Black Dance Collective
description: Black Dance Collective is dance organization steeped in the rich traditions of Katherine Dunham, Pearl Primus, Alvin Ailey, Geoffrey Holder and other luminaries of the Black Concert Dance aesthetic. Our purpose is to carry those legacies and continue the cultivation of black art at Sacramento State. BDC provides a forum for the exploration of African-derived movement and culture within the context of American modern dance. Our mission is to perform, educate and instruct within various communities: academic, public and private collectively giving back to our society at large.

name: Black Healthcare Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to encourage, guide, and provide mentorship to future Black health care workers as well as providing exclusive guidance to younger classmen with similar career goals in medicine. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Black Honors College
description: Membership Benefits

name: Black Student Union
description: Purpose: The purpose of this organization is to serve as a resource to unite and uplift the Black community on campus through various events, community engagement, and opportunities for the success of the individual and the student body as a whole. We strive to get our members involved and aware of the social issues and achievements of the Black community.

name: Business Analytics Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to explore the data science tools and analytical insight used to sold complex business issues. The academic club is dedicated to exposing members to the skills and opportunities in a high-growth career field.

name: Business Honors Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a single platform for current Business Honors (BHON) Students to collaborate at Sacramento State as well as in the Sacramento business community through participation in networking for business and personal development, as well as serving the community by giving back and volunteering time.

name: Calaveras Station Arts & Literary Journal
description: The purpose of this organization is to publish a journal of student Art & Literature, edited by a committee of students, each Spring Semester.

name: California Geotechnical Engineering Association
description: The purpose of the California Geotechnical Engineering Association (CalGeo) Student Chapter at Sac State is to supplement students' academic education with a diverse exposure to geotechnical engineering. As one of only 7 student chapters in California, CalGeo at Sac State offers a unique and personalized opportunity to learn geotechnical engineering and related fields. CalGeo will participate in monthly meetings hosted by both the student chapter and the parent organization feature insightful presentations by professors, principal engineers, licensed geotechnical engineers, and licensed geologists. CalGeo members are supported by all of CalGeo through mentors, scholarships, and networking opportunities. Sac State works closely with ASCE's GeoWall team in funding a competing design at the annual MidPac Conference. CalGeo always welcomes new members to explore the field of geotechnical engineering.

name: California Nursing Students' Association
description: The purpose of the CNSA, Sacramento State Chapter is To assume responsibility for contributing to nursing education in order to provide for the highest quality health care; To provide programs representative of fundamental and current professional interests and concerns; To aid in the development of the whole person, professional role, and responsibility for the health care of people in all walks of life; To have direct input into standards of nursing education and influence the education process; To influence health care, nursing education, and practice through legislative activities as appropriate; To promote and encourage participation in community affairs and activities towards improved health care and the resolution of related issues;  To represent nursing students to the consumer, to institutions, and other organizations; To promote and encourage opportunities for underrepresented students in nursing and CNSA; To promote and encourage students' participation in interdisciplinary activities;  To promote and encourage collaborative relationships with professional nursing organizations and health related organizations; To promote and encourage collaborative relationships with other student organizations; To participate as an active constituent of CNSA and NSNA through dually elected representatives.

name: Cambodian Students and Alumni Organization
description: The purpose of this organization is to celebrate Cambodia’s rich cultural heritage while building a strong, supportive community for Cambodian students and allies at CSU Sacramento. Through club gatherings, cultural events, alumni connections, and advocacy, we strive to create a welcoming environment that honors our traditions, supports one another, and encourages personal and academic growth. Our mission is to empower students to connect with their roots, build lasting friendships, and contribute to the diverse fabric of the university community.

name: Camerata Capistrano
description: The purpose of this organization is to educate students on the context and performance of baroque era music. This will be done with period style rehearsal and performance of baroque and pre-baroque music.

name: Campus Life
description: Membership Benefits

name: Career Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Caribbean Student Association
description: The Caribbean Student Association is dedicated to promoting and uplifting the rich history, vibrant culture, and dynamic community of the Caribbean. Our primary focus is on fostering an inclusive environment that celebrates diversity. Through educational initiatives, cultural events, and community-building activities, we strive to create a supportive and enriching space for Caribbean students and their allies. We are committed to providing opportunities for learning, growth, and connection, ensuring that the voices and stories of the Caribbean are heard and valued on campus.

name: Ceramics Guild
description: The Ceramics Guild intends to provide a space for students to practice ceramics techniques and to foster relationships among members of the ceramics community at Sacramento State. Upon joining and participating in Ceramics Guild events such as exhibitions, special firings, guest artist demonstrations, and sales, we hope that you will develop a deeper relationship with clay and the greaterÂ Sacramento ceramics community.

name: Chemistry Club
description: To promote exchange between students studying chemistry and the chemical sciences at California State University, Sacramento. The club also provides outreach to the community through volunteer projects in schools and participates in National Chemistry Week activities each year. The club enables students studying chemistry to connect with one another for tutoring, as well as providing opportunities for professional development.

name: Chess Club
description: This club's purpose is to provide a space for members to improve their Chess skills and learn from other club members.

name: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
description: The mission of Chi Alpha shall be to develop the spiritual life and abilities of the students in relation to God, to each other, and to the world at large within a Pentecostal Christian context and in a manner consistent with the teachings of the Assemblies of God USA. As part of this mission, Chi Alpha seeks to introduce fellow collegians to an authentic relationship with Jesus Christ. Chi Alpha plans to do this through:Prayer - Communication with God.Worship - Expressions of thanks through word, music, and serviceFellowship - Community of students developing quality relationships.Discipleship - Learning about Jesus and following His example.Mission - Living a life that reflects our relationship with God in what we say and do.

name: Chi Sigma Iota, Chi Sigma Sigma Chapter
description: CSI is the counseling academic and professional honor society. We provide professional development in counseling.

name: Chinese Language Club
description: The Chinese Language Club is for any student that has interest in learning Mandarin, continue practicing their Mandarin, learning about the contemporary Chinese society, culture and history. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Choral Club
description: As an extension of the existing two choirs (University Chorale and Choral Union) within the CSUS School of Music, this organization’s purpose is to increase the level of participation, engagement, and leadership within choirs through member involvement in the planning and leading of rehearsals and repertoire learning. The club actively engages in community outreach to increase engagement in choir performances and choir membership.

name: Christian Students
description: The purpose of this organization is to meet students interested in the Bible and to encourage students to pursue Christ by reading the Bible, praying, meeting together, and announcing the gospel.

name: Circle K International
description: The mission of this club shall be: Circle K International develops college and university students into a global network of responsible citizens and leaders with a lifelong commitment to service.

name: Clarinet Club
description: The clarinet club is dedicated to provide a safe community for Sacramento States clarinet enthusiasts of all skill levels. Our mission is to inspire Sac State students playing the clarinet’s creativity, provide necessary supplies and supporting their musical journey

name: College Assistance Migrant Program
description: Membership Benefits

name: College Democrats
description: As the representative organization of the Democratic Party at California StateÂ University, Sacramento, the goal of the College Democrats at Sacramento State isÂ to further the ideas and ideals of the Democratic Party. We vow to uphold theÂ Democratic principles of freedom, social justice, equality, and promote the formation of a society which extends those principles to all, regardless of race, sex, ethnicity, national origin, religion, physical handicap, socioeconomic status, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Furthermore, we seek to increase the involvement of students in the political process by raising awareness of the values and mission of the Democratic Party and by facilitating their direct involvement. It is for this reason and upon these ideals which we establish the College Democrats at Sacramento State.

name: College of Engineering & Computer Science
description: Membership Benefits

name: College Republicans
description: The College Republicans are a community of Conservatives united around the ideas of individual freedom, freedom of speech, a strong national defense, free enterprise, and traditional values.Â The College Republicans are committed to promoting Conservative ideas on campus, advancing and growing the Conservative Movement on our campus and in the local community, promoting Patriotism and American Pride, advocating for Free Speech and for university policies to comply with the First Amendment, fostering intellectual diversity by hosting Conservative speakers, and assisting local candidates with campus exposure.

name: Collegiate 100
description: The purpose of this organization is to support men and women in providing professional development on and off campus through various of networking opportunities.

name: Combat U - Boxing Club
description: Sac State's Combat U Boxing Club Goal is to help members enhance their boxing skills and fitness levels by providing regular practice and tailored instruction. The club's purpose is to promote balanced skill development. It encourages boxers of all backgrounds and skill levels to come together and learn in a friendly environment that fosters a healthy lifestyle using organized training and exercise. The club provides opportunities for competition by hosting internal sparring sessions and participating in external events. Additionally, it emphasizes community engagement

name: Combat U - Jiu Jitsu
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a platform for individuals to learn, practice and master the art of Brazilian Jiu- Jitsu in a safe and supportive environment. The club seeks to prepare members for both recreational and competitive opportunities, helping them advance towards their personal and professional goals.

name: Combat U - Kickboxing
description: The purpose of this organization is to have participants learn the art of kickboxing while having fun and getting in shape.

name: Combat U - MMA
description: The purpose of this organization is to cultivate and develop the skills of aspiring Mixed Martial Artists by providing comprehensive training and competitive opportunities. We strive to prepare athletes for higher- level competitions and support their journey toward a professional MMA career in the sport.

name: Combat U - Wrestling
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a platform for individuals to learn, practice and master the art of Wrestling in a safe and supportive environment. The club seeks to prepare members for both recreational and competitive opportunities, helping them advance towards their personal and professional goals.

name: Communication Graduate Student Association
description: The Communication Graduate Student Association (CGSA) is an organization by graduate students for graduate students. The purpose of this club is to build community and promote well-being among Communication Studies scholars. CGSA advocates for students’ academic and professional goals. Through student-to-student connection, CGSA serves as a resource library to support members’ success.

name: Community Psychology Club
description: The purpose of this club is to focus on community-based research in schools around the Sacramento State campus through the Psychology department with graduate and undergraduate students as research assistants.Â

name: Competitive Cheer Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to compete competitively at the collegiate level.

name: Competitive Dance Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide unwavering spirit, energy, and enthusiasm while representing the University in areas such as athletic events, rallies, promotional activities, public relations efforts, community service-related projects, and competition. In this role, it is very important that each individual member and the Dance Team collectively make every effort to cooperate in the advancement of the purposes and welfare of the University. It is imperative that each dance member displays the highest possible standards of effort, conduct, competence, and good taste in performance, not only while wearing the uniform, but also in dance membersâ€™ personal lives.

name: Competitive Robotics
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote professional development through team-based engineering project experience and relevant applications of academic material, as well as community and campus involvement.

name: Concrete Canoe Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to involve students interested in the field of engineering with a year-long project that provides them with hands-on experience applicable to their future engineering careers while competing regionally for a national title. In addition to experiential education, students interact with peers, faculty, and industry professionals to build strong networks and life-long friends.

name: Construction Management Association of America Student Chapter
description: To provide students with career and scholarship opportunities in the construction industry through networking and events in association with CMAA

name: Construction Management Student Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to foster the professional development of students for the construction industry through networking opportunities, site visits, presentations and community participation.

name: Counselors for Social Justice
description: The Counselors for Social Justice at California State University, Sacramento, is dedicated to acknowledging and combating the systemic oppression affecting our clients, students, faculty, and the wider community. Our mission is driven by equity, justice, and liberation principles, striving to address and reduce disparities through active collaboration with local communities and engagement in the political process. We see advocacy as a term and a core part of our identity as counselors, pushing us to form alliances and tackle barriers at institutional and systemic levels. We aim to empower students interested in social justice with a supportive community, connections, and advocacy opportunities, enhancing their education with additional training beyond the traditional curriculum. This initiative will help shape their identities as social justice advocates and sharpen their advocacy skills. We commit to sharing the latest research in social justice advocacy, facilitating discussions on various advocacy methods, and mobilizing collective actions within our school and community to address social inequities and promote change.

name: Cricket Club
description: The Cricket Club aims to build a welcoming community that introduces the game of cricket to new players while providing a platform for enthusiasts to connect, compete, and grow. We are committed to promoting teamwork, diversity, and school spirit through cricket, fostering both athletic and cultural exchange. By combining passion for the sport with the Hornet pride, our mission is to inspire unity, healthy competition, and lasting friendships on and off the field.

name: Crochet Club
description: Crochet Club teaches fun and engaging crochet workshops that accommodate all skill levels, including beginners and seasoned experts. Crochet Club welcomes all types of people, such as knitters, rug tufters, or anyone interested in yarn & fiber art!

name: Cru
description: The purpose of the Chapter, as articulated in the Charter, is to build movements of people whoare transformed by Jesus Christ. The student-led movement seeks to introduce students to JesusChrist, help them to grow in their faith, encourage them to live life passionately under thelordship of Christ, and inspire commitment to advancing the purposes of God in the world.

name: Cyber Security Club
description: Explore and practice cyber security topics for both recreation and professional preparation.

name: Cycling Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to spread the joy of riding bicycles and connect others through cycling. It will take its members on various routes within and around the Sacramento area and educate them on the benefits and safety of cycling. Furthermore, it will explore multiple disciplines of cycling, from road to mountain to gravel biking.

name: Dance Alliance
description: Create an inclusive environment within the Sacramento community through the medium of dance. Promoting dance groups throughout the region to enlighten many of the nature and power of the art form. We will be bringing divided dance worlds together create a safe space and understanding of the world of dance. Specifically, we will host fundraising events that relate to the political climate of our dance world to raise money for the American Dance College Association (ACDA). It is our intention to send a group of dance majors and minors from Sacramento State to ACDA to promote and develop the skills of students for career growth.

name: Data Science Club
description: The Data Science Club at Sac State, aims to empower students by offering complimentary workshops and educational resources that equip them with cutting-edge technical skills essential in the data science industry. This initiative is particularly significant due to the absence of an attainable data science degree program at our university.In addition, we host guest speakers from diverse fields and industries who illuminate the pervasive impact of data science on various aspects of life. They also provide insights on how individuals, regardless of their academic background, can embark on their data science journey.

name: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: The mission of this organization is to provide a forum to exchange ideas and foster discussions for all students interested in the technical pursuit of this core computing concept. In addition, this club will provide technical interview practice, networking opportunities, and growth opportunities for any students interested. The club will foster social interaction for members through hosting events such as programming workshops, group projects, weekly problem discussions, and leetcode contests. It will coordinate events and lectures with the Computer Science Department at Sac State but is open to all students.

name: Delta Epsilon Mu, Nu Chapter
description: The members of Delta Epsilon Mu, Inc. are committed to serving the community by advocating health education and care, and through active participation in service activities, fundraising, and outreach programs. Members are given the opportunity to directly participate in health-oriented workshops and discussions, thereby attaining access to pertinent academic and career information through association with professors, advisors, career professionals, Alumni Members and fellow Active Members.

name: Delta Gamma
description: The objects of the Fraternity shall be to foster high ideals of friendship among women, to promote their educational and cultural interests, to create in them a true sense of social responsibility, and to develop in them the best qualities of character.

name: Delta Lambda Phi
description: The primary purpose of the chapter is to be a social fraternity. This, however, shall not preclude the chapter or any individual member from participating in events or activities that support the Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual community politically, socially, or otherwise. If the majority of the membership in the quorum deems an activity in which the fraternity as a whole shall participate to be of a political nature, approval must pass with at least a 75% majority.

name: Delta Sigma Pi
description: To connect students and professionals through the practice of business, helping them realize their full potential in the Epsilon Phi Chapter of Delta Sigma Pi.

name: Design Build Institute of America
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote the value of design-build and integrated project delivery. We aim to provide DBIA accreditation courses and network with professionals to learn the effective integration of design and construction services to ensure success for owners, designers, and construction practitioners. We plan to create long-lasting relationships throughout the industry.

name: Disability Justice Club
description: The purpose of the Disability Justice Club is present to protect, support, and empower disabled students of California State University, Sacramento as they pursue their academics. DJC is here to support students as they navigate the Disability systems of California State University Sacramento as well as to continue advocating for a more accessible institution. All who are passionate about disability justice are welcomed, disabled or not.

name: Disabled Individuals & Non-Disabled Individuals Organization
description: Disabled Individuals & Non-disabled Individuals Organization is an organization that focuses on bringing disabled and non-disabled individuals together in the community to provide advocacy, support, socialization and belonging.

name: Disciples Reaching and Evangelizing all Mankind Campus Ministry
description: Welcome to D.R.E.A.M Campus Ministry! Our purpose as a club here on campus is to help students better their relationship with God, learn how to actively read the bible, and give people a family oriented community to grow in.Â

name: Diverse Women in Political Science
description: We strive to create a respectful and inclusive environment that encourages all students to learn from socio-political discussions, while using healthy communication skills. We aim to be mindful of intersectional identities, committing to anti-racism, and advocating for collective solutions to address issues, including but not limited to those faced by identities of women.

name: Doctorate in Educational Leadership Student Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to work within the interrelated themes of transformational leadership, critical policy analysis and action, and informed decisions making, to have a significant impact and produce exemplary educational leadership for schools, community colleges, and related educational areas. To provide cohesions, a sense of community, and a network of support that fosters academic, personal, and professional success throughout their doctoral journey and beyond.DELSA will promote scholarship, academic and professional development, networking, and interpersonal communication skills that are essentials to building successfulÂ careers after completion of the program.

name: Dramatist Society
description: The Dramatist Society's purpose is to provide and support the students in the Sac State Theater and Dance departments and those interested in pursuing passions in those fields, and provide a safe and comfortable space for discussion and activities related to Theater related productions and events.

name: Dreamer Resource Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: East African Students Association
description: The East African Students Association at Sacramento State University is dedicated to fostering a vibrant and inclusive community that celebrates the rich cultural heritage of East Africa. Our mission is to create a supportive environment for students of East African descent, promote cultural awareness and appreciation across campus, and provide opportunities for academic, social, and personal growth. Through dynamic events, educational initiatives, and collaborative partnerships, we aim to enhance the cultural diversity of Sacramento State, while empowering our members to thrive academically and professionally.

name: Educational Opportunity Program Student Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote retention and engagement in Sac State’s EOP program beyond the first year; develop member’s potential for academic excellence, personal growth, and career success; as well as coordinate activities that bring support to EOP students, students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds, and other underrepresented student groups in the higher education system.

name: Engineering and Computer Science Joint Council
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a voice for the students of the College of Engineering and Computer Science (ECS). The ECSJC shall promote the recruitment and retention of the students of the College of ECS, facilitate communication and collaboration between ECS clubs and organizations, and support the College of ECS in its endeavor to better the surrounding community.

name: Engineers Without Borders
description: The purpose of this organization is to partner with underserved communities at home and internationally to build a more sustainable world. These community-driven partnerships address essential needs with climate conscious infrastructure while cultivating engineering and leadership skills in our partners and chapter volunteers.

name: English Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a platform for students who are interested in learning and improving their English language skills, as well as to promote cultural exchange and diversity among the members.Â The club also fosters a supportive and friendly environment where students can practice their English communication skills and make new friends. The club organizes various activities, such as open mic poetry and prose reading, book clubs, movie nights, and other events that aim to enhance the linguistic and intercultural competencies of the participants.Â The English Club welcomes students from all majors, levels, and backgrounds who share a common passion for the English language and culture.â€‹

name: Ensuring Native Indian Traditions
description: The purpose of this organization includes the following: To promote higher education for American Indian Students.b.  To promote positive social and cultural activities among Native and non- Native Students.c.  To be a resource for curriculum, financial aid, scholarships, tutoring, support, and other assistance programs both within the ENIT group and throughout the academic as well as the general community.d. To promote skill development and wellness through the participation of trainings, conferences, workshops whether put on by ENIT or put on by outside interest groups. e. Provide lecture series for students on campus that promote completion and the pursuit for higher educationf. To preserve and protect the rights and responsibilities of Native American Traditions.

name: Environmental Student Organization
description: The purpose of this organization is to educate the Sacramento State University campus on current environmental issues and to spread environmental awareness in the community. We are a nonpartisan group and welcome all members to engage in environmentalism through volunteer work, educational efforts, and activism.

name: Epsilon Sigma Rho Multicultural Fraternity Inc.
description: The mission statement of Epsilon Sigma Rho Multicultural Fraternity Inc. Is to empower men of diverse cultural backgrounds to achieve academic excellence, develop leadership skills, and cultivate a commitment to community service. The fraternity strives to foster brotherhood, cultural awareness, and a sense of social responsibility among its members, while promoting personal growth and academic success.

name: Esports Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to participate in various competitions across multiple game titles and provide Sacramento State Students the opportunity to develop leadership, communication, and cooperation skills in a competitive or non-competitive environment.

name: Ethnic Studies Student Association
description: The Ethnic Studies Student Association is committed to empowering Black, Indigenous, and students of color, and allies through the preservation and teaching of Ethnic Studies. Since the establishment of the first Ethnic Studies Department in 1969, at the San Francisco State University, students have committed to the fight for proper representation in our education. We will continue the struggle to ensure a true and accurate history of our social justice in efforts of liberation for all peoples. The Ethnic Studies Student Association will work alongside California State University of Sacramento students to provide necessary resources to achieve this goal and support our student community

name: Field Biology Group
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide educational, networking, and career development opportunities for people interested in field biology.

name: Financial Planning Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to benefit students who are interested in financial planning along with professional development opportunities. Student Chapter club members of the Financial Planning Association (FPA) can expect to build their professional network in the financial planning field and attend free events ranging from guest speakers, professional development, and socials. Other purposes of the Student Chapter are to give students the opportunity to learn about financial planning, have exposure to financial professionals, obtain internships and employment opportunities, and develop interpersonal and leadership skills.

name: First-Gen Biz Bees
description: The purpose of this organization is to empower first-generation business students on their path to success by providing mentorship, resources, and a supportive community, ensuring equitable access to education and opportunities in the world of business. All students are welcome

name: Food and Nutrition Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to unite Sacramento State students pursuing careers and lifestyles centered on health, wellness, and food. Through professional opportunities and acts of public service, we strive to expand our campus community's understanding of food and its impact on all aspects of life. Our goal is to enrich the experience of membership by helping our fellow students accomplish their career goals, develop confidence in leadership, and educate the campus community.

name: Forensic Engineering Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to advance engineering excellence through critical analysis of engineering endeavors where failure has resulted in loss of use, injury or death. We value education, excellence, engagement, innovation, and integrity in engineering.

name: Future Business Leaders of America
description: FBLA at Sac State is a business student organization initiated to bring like-minded students together to prepare for their professional future career goals through Networking and Innovative leadership activities.

name: Gamma Phi Beta
description: The purpose of the standing rules shall be to effect positive student development, on an individual and chapter level while forming the foundation for lifetime commitment to Gamma Phi Beta. Development implies that the growth is to be pursued as a desirable psychological, educational and moral end.

name: Gamma Zeta Alpha
description: The specific purposes of this corporation shall be to promote higher education to all people, specifically to the Latino Community which includes, but is not limited to, promoting and educating the community on Latino culture,providing academic support for its members, and engaging in community service projects. The chapters of Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc. are the lifelines of the Fraternity; and therefore, each must function with the utmost effectiveness in performing services for the community and developing both the professional and personal development of its members. We are committed to excellence in training chapters and officers in the fundamental skills necessary to run an effective chapter.

name: Geo-Challenge
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide hands-on experience while designing and building a model-sized mechanically stabilized earth retaining wall which will be used in competition at the National American Society of Civil Engineer's Mid-Pacific Conference. Our goal is to work as a team to design the most stable MSE wall using the least amount of materials. The organization hosts events and seminars that facilitate Geo-Challenge's goals and objectives and educate California State University, Sacramento students on theÂ field of Geotechnical Engineering.

name: Geology Club
description: This organization aims to provide a community of like-minded individuals who are interested in the geological sciences and give resources to students in careerÂ and educational advancement in geology.

name: Girl Up
description: Girl Up is a club open to all students who are focused on girl-centered leadership development initiatives, focusing on equity for girls and women in spaces where they are unheard or underrepresented. The club is open to everyone regardless of identity!

name: Girls Who Code
description: The purpose of this organization, Girls Who Code, is to bridge the gender gap in technology by fostering a love for coding, developing technical skills, building confidence, and promoting inclusivity. Through club activities, workshops, and guest speakers, we provide opportunities for students to explore coding in an engaging manner, gain proficiency in technical concepts, and cultivate self-assurance. Our community emphasizes diversity and offers networking and mentoring opportunities to support members in their educational and career journeys, creating a space where students can learn, grow, and empower each other in the tech industry.

name: Global Medical Brigades
description: Global Medical Brigades is a student-led organization that implements a holistic model to achieve the health and economic goals of rural communities in Honduras, Panama, Guatemala, Ghana, Belize, and Greece. In collaboration with other GB Chapters at various universities, our Chapter engages in year-round recruitment and fundraising events, which culminate in our participation in a 7-9 day brigade. During this time, we actively contribute to programming and volunteering efforts, directly impacting the communities we serve.

name: Gospel Choir
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote and nurture gospel music in practice and performances through Gospel Choir.

name: Graduate Association of Students in Public Policy and Adminstration
description: The purpose of this organization is to enhance the experience for students in or interested in the Public Policy and Administration (PPA) and Urban Land Development (ULD) programs housed within the Department of Public Policy and Administration (Department) at California State University, Sacramento. Specifically, GASPPA:Supports the Departmentâ€™s PPA and ULD programsProvides educational, professional, and social support for interested and current PPA and ULD studentsPromotes positive relations between students, faculty, alumni, the community, and the University

name: Graduate Public Health Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to prepare public health students for graduate focused practice and leadership in the field and provide advice and feedback to the Department of Public Health at California State University, Sacramento. This organization will support students interested in pursuing advanced training and graduate education in public health and provide opportunities to connect with their peers, practicing professionals, and community connections.

name: GRIDS Graphic Design
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide students the opportunity to supplement, support, and strengthen their design education through networking, events, and shared resources among other design students and industry professionals. We also strive to enhance the graphic design study experience and foster community amongst members.

name: Guardian Scholars Program
description: The Guardian Scholars Program at Sacramento State is designed to support current and former foster youth students by increasing graduation rates and their overall success. Students who have experienced the foster care system have unique needs and challenges. The GSP program offers various services to support their journey at Sac State. Being a part of the program means more than just a resource; you are part of a family.

name: Healthcare Administration Club
description: The purpose of this organization to provide students the opportunity to learn about the operations of healthcare, learn about the different career paths, expand their network, hear from guest speakers, and become aware of any internships or job opportunities.Â

name: HerCampus
description: Her Campus is a student organization and online magazine dedicated to empowering, celebrating, and guiding college women. Created by college students for college students, HerCampus serves the campus, giving a fresh and unique experience through localized editorial content, social media channels, events and more!

name: Higher Education Leadership Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide professional development, leadership skills, and networking opportunities to both undergraduate and graduate students who are interested in the higher education field

name: History Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to facilitate social events centered around students who enjoy learning about history and discussing it. We host and attend group activities such as museum and archive tours, networking events with professionals, and career workshops.

name: Hmong Bible Study
description: To learn the bible and spread the good news of Jesus Christ to college students.

name: Hmong University Student Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote higher education to the community, promote Hmong culture, and be a supportive group to the members.

name: Homeless Advocates
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote the well-being for all people who are unhoused and disadvantaged, or at the risk of being so, in Sacramento.

name: Honors Program Students
description: The purpose of this organization is to foster an environment in which our Honors Society can celebrate and embrace program ideals and values such as diversity, global awareness, and lifelong learning. We are to represent the Honors Program to the best of our ability, to create a safe and welcoming environment in which all Honors members are given a fair chance of being heard, and to establish a sense of community among our Honors Society between members, faculty, and the university campus as a whole.

name: Hornet Aerospace and Propulsion
description: The purpose of this organization is to supplement a student's university coursework with challenging hands-on team projects in aeronautics, astronautics, rocketry, propulsion, and avionics.

name: Hornet Communication
description: To provide a space for social and professional development for those interested in Communication Studies.

name: Hornet Cosplay Club
description: To provide a welcoming space for individuals to share and explore various forms of cosplay. The club aims to foster meaningful connections and friendships among members while encouraging creativity and self-expression.

name: Hornet Film Society
description: Our mission is to give students hands on experience with filmmaking and give students a creative place to make their own original film projects and network to form connections with future filmmakers.

name: Hornet Geography Club
description: The purpose of the "Hornet Geography Club" is to create a fun and inclusive environment for geography enthusiasts to network and connect.

name: Hornet Racing-Formula SAE
description: Hornet Racing strives to produce the finest and most competitive formula SAE race car in at least one of the seven international Formula SAE competitions every year. In doing so, we help to enrich our members' learning experience beyond what they can obtain in the classroom through extensive hands-on design and manufacturing experience. We make every effort to include any and all students, including non-engineer majors, who are willing to participate, and to provide them with a constructive learning environment that will help to build the program and increases its knowledge base every year. We will accomplish those goals through honest hard work, dedication, teamwork, and effective communication.

name: Human Resources Management Group
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide CSUS students with a platform where they can network, learn about internship & job opportunities, and explore several human resources topics on professional levels.

name: Improv Club
description: Perform Improv exercises and games to explore the use of improv in life and fun.

name: Inclusive Excellence
description: Inclusive Excellence at Sacramento State is committed to fostering a campus environment that embraces, empowers, and elevates all Sac State community members. Our mission centers on fostering a campus culture where every student, faculty, staff, and community member feels a profound sense of belonging—being appreciated for their unique contributions, connected to colleagues, supported in daily work and career development, and proud of our institutional values. We strive to create a better serving institution for all. IE operations reach all areas of our campus and bridge us with the broader community through three pillars: Collaborative Servingness: Engaging all areas of campus and the broader community in shared efforts to uplift and serve all. Cultural Insights: Harnessing knowledge and experiences to celebrate cultural richness and create transformative spaces of belonging. Compassionate Compliance: Ensuring compassion and belonging, not just regulatory approaches, are embedded into how we operate and lead.

name: Institute of Transportation Engineers
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a regular way for civil engineering students to learn about transportation engineering and its industry. Gain industry exposure by attending in transportation conferences and ongoing projects. This club is also meant to assist students in professional development.

name: Interfraternity Council
description: We, the Interfraternity Council at California State University, Sacramento (Sacramento State) set forth this Constitution and Bylaws in order to cause closer working relationships and coordination among its member chapters and Sacramento State, in accordance with the policies and standards established by the North American Interfraternity Conference (NIC). We, the Interfraternity Council (IFC) exists to advance conditions conducive to the success of its member chapters and to promote the progress of the fraternity experience. With this aim, the IFC actively encourages interfraternalism and collaboration with other fraternity/sorority governing councils and student governance bodies. Maintaining a positive working relationship and partnership with the campus administration, alumni, NIC and inter/national headquarters of member chapters is critical toward elevating the role of the IFC.

name: International Interior Design Association
description: The purpose of IIDA is to serve as a professional association nurturing the community, and future advancement of interior designers.

name: International Student Life
description: The purpose of this organization is to be a valuable resource in helping all international students at California State University Sacramento be successful in school and in their transition into the United States and to have fun.

name: InterVarsity Christian Fellowship
description: In response to God's love, grace and truth: The Purpose of the Chapter is to establish and advance at Sacramento State witnessing communities of students and faculty who follow Jesus as Savior and Lord: growing in love for God, God's Word, God's people of every ethnicity and culture and God's purposes in the world.

name: Japan Club
description: The purpose of Japan Club is to increase cultural awareness and understanding at California State University of Sacramento and foster a stronger community between Japanese and American Students on campus. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Jazz Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote the Sacramento State Jazz Studies Degree Program and culture on campus by attending University concerts, guest artist lectures & clinics, and supporting jazz music in the community through outreach concerts and educational seminars.

name: Jewish Student Union
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide space and resources to the culture and activities of Jewish life on campus.

name: Judo Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a safe and productive environment for judo enthusiast to practice the sport of judo.

name: Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.
description: To encourage honorable achievement in every field of human endeavor. To promote the spiritual, social, intellectual, and moral welfare of its members. To aid the aims and purposes of colleges and universities. To inspire service in the public interest.

name: Kappa Delta Chi
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote the traditional values of Unity, Honesty, Integrity, and Leadership among women. We are dedicated to providing services to both the University and the community, with a special emphasis on the Hispanic population. We also keep a high standard of achievement in areas of academics. Our sisterhood seeks to open the door to other women andÂ to unite and involve its members through service, academics, and social activities.Â

name: Kappa Psi Epsilon
description: To provide leadership in presenting a cohesive course of action to advance the academic, social, scholastic, and professional objectives of the members. To instill the desire for continuous self-improvement. To provide prospective members with common interests and goals, the opportunity to engage in a unique space that emphasizes Pilipin@ and Pilipin@-American culture.

name: Kappa Sigma
description: The purpose of the Nu Lambda Chapter is to advance the ideas and principles of Kappa Sigma, while at all times excelling in all aspects of student life at California State University, Sacramento, particularly in those areas of academics, leadership, community service, and social grace. It is the duty of every member of this chapter to work diligently toward fulfilling this purpose so that we may equal, but none excel.

name: Kin-dom House
description: The purpose of Kin-dom House is to engage the community to become supporters for peace with justice work grounded in faith and values through Christianity. We are committed to the challenge of realizing the transformative and liberative aspects of the Christian faith in unity and service of the oppressed, leading the Christian student to a reawakened relevance on campus, and in the church and wider society. It is open to all students of any background. Our Goals are to: • Raise Awareness. • Empower to Organize. • Mobilize for Service. This model is rooted and grounded in Jesus who he himself was a community organizer. Our purpose is to consult with students with their needs, interests and an invitation to be engaged in the Christian faith as an avenue for spirituality through faith and activism.

name: Korean Student Association
description: To teach non Korean students about Korean culture and to teach Korean students about American culture through events, meetings and activities.Â

name: Krescendo K-Pop Dance
description: We are a K-pop dance team and our goals are: a. To produce K-pop dance pieces on social media. b. Spread awareness of K-pop culture through dance showcases, performances, competitions. These goals will be achieved in an inclusive manner regarding K-pop knowledge. We encourage fun and team bonding experience for all members as it must be balanced with focusing on team goals and expectations.

name: Lambda Sigma Gamma
description: The purposes of this association are to instill the desire for self-improvement, scholastic excellence and the cultivation of civic responsibility; also to promote unity and higher education amongst women.

name: Lambda Theta Alpha
description: Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Inc. Mission Statement: To provide a sisterhood based on Unity, Love and Respect; to provide social and cultural activities, and to carry on charitable and educational programs to promote leadership, maintain high academic standards, and serve as a voice for the Latino community.Â

name: Lambda Theta Phi
description: The mission of Lambda Theta Phi is to empower the Latin male through scholarship, Brotherhood, opportunity and protection of identity and equality. IDEALS 1. To establish a brotherhood 2. To establish and maintain a high standard of learning 3. To raise the standards of morality and develop character 4. To respect culture and practice chivalry 5. To promote the spirit of mans dignity and self-identity.

name: Lavender Alliance
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote, improve and advocate for the general welfare and interests of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgendered, Queer and Questioning, Intersex, Asexual, Non-Binary, Gender Non-Conforming, herein known as LGBTQIA+, students of California State University Sacramento (CSUS).

name: Management Information Systems Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to help our members build a dynamic network in their field of study. We connect CSUS faculty, alumni, and potential employers to our members through a series of events and workshops held over the course of every semester.

name: Marching Band
description: The purpose of this organization is to maintain and support the activities of the Marching Band at California State University, Sacramento and to provide student leadership and engagement to the largest and most spirited organization on campus.

name: Master of Fine Arts
description: The purpose of this organization is to support and enrich the experience of Master of Fine Arts Students during their tenure in the program.

name: Master of Science in Business Analytics Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to serve Sacramento State's Master of Science in Business Analytics (MSBA) alumni, students, and those interested in the program by helping them connect data and models to substantive business problems for decision making as well as provide spaces and opportunities to network with other data professionals in the field.

name: Material Advantage Club
description: The purpose of this club is to study and create works related to and derived from material science applications and mechanical engineering.

name: Math Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to bring together anyone who has an interest in learning about math topics outside of the classroom. Professors, grad students, and even club members present talks and facilitate activities during club meetings.

name: MEChA
description: A. To carry out the objectives established in El Plan de Santa Barbara, El Plan de Aztlán, and the Philosophy of M.E.Ch.A.; B. To strive for social, educational, cultural, economic, and political empowerment within the Chicana/o Community; C. To encourage Chicana/Chicano student to seek higher education, graduate, and promote Chicanismo within the Chicana/o Community; D. To promote the retention of the Chicano student population on the Sac State Campus; E. To maintain and further the unity and involvement among the Chicana/Chicano students on the Sac State Campus; F. To promote our cultura and historia; G. To retain and advance our Chicana/Chicano identity; H. To maintain contact with the Penutian M.E.Ch.A. Central, the Alta Califas Norte M.E.Ch.A. Región, California Statewide M.E.Ch.A., and National M.E.Ch.A.

name: Mechanical Contractors Association of America
description: The purpose of this organization is to introduce and promote mechanical and electrical contracting among students. 1. Promote communication and networking between student members and contractors. 2. Expand the students members's knowledge of the mechanical contracting industry. 3. Unite and promote fellowship between students members and the professional societies that serve the mechanical contracting industry. 4. Familiarize students, faculty and administration with the professional character and economic impact of the mechanical contracting industry.

name: Men's Rugby Club
description: Empowering Excellence, On and Off the Field At Sac State Men's Rugby Club, our vision is to cultivate not just exceptional rugby players, but well-rounded individuals who embody the spirit of teamwork, resilience, and continuous growth. We are committed to fostering a dynamic environment where every player is encouraged to develop both mentally and physically, embracing challenges as opportunities for advancement.We believe in the power of a united team, where each member contributes to a collective goal and takes pride in our shared achievements. Through effective communication, emotional intelligence, and a strong sense of community, we aim to create an atmosphere of mutual respect and understanding.Our focus extends beyond the rugby field. We are dedicated to nurturing leaders who excel in all aspects of life, balancing sportsmanship with academic excellence and personal development. Through mindfulness practices, resilience training, and a commitment to a healthy lifestyle, we equip our athletes with the skills necessary to succeed in any endeavor.In embodying these values, Sac State Menâ€™s Rugby Club strives to be a beacon of excellence, setting a standard for sportsmanship, teamwork, and personal growth. We are more than a team; we are a family, a community, and a legacy in the making.

name: Men's Soccer Club
description: To compete in high level of competition at the West Coast Soccer Association while establishing a culture involved with respect, commitment, and creating group cohesion. As a member you will be involved with the community, sports clubs, and Sac state.Â

name: Men's Volleyball Club
description: We help young men grow not only as a College student-athletes but as college students. Teaching discipline, responsibility and how to be respectful. To bring out a player's passion for the game of Volleyball by first-hand experiences and passion for the game. To also pass on the traditions of the club, college, and student body. All while enjoying the game of volleyball. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students
description: The purpose of this organization is to bring an opportunity for pre-health students at Sacramento State to get involved in leadership positions, learn about possible opportunities in the health professions that include medicine, nursing, physician assistants. Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students (MAPS) represent minority undergraduate student at Sacramento State that will bring diversity into health care professions. Our meetings provide opportunities for these students to get involved in volunteer and clinical service in the community. We also provide mentorship and an ability to network with people in the healthcare field. Our purpose is to help our members to achieve their goals and help them grow their grit. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: MLK Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Model United Nations
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote Model United Nations across the campus and support students through personal and professional endeavors.

name: Mujeres Ayudando La Raza
description: We as founding mothers of Mujeres Ayudando La Raza (M.A.R), in accordance with California State University, Sacramento, have established this non-profit organization for the purpose of creating a network of support for Chicanx/Latinx students. Our objective is to promote academic excellence by aiding in the retention of our members in the University. Mujeres Ayudando La Raza is committed to the welfare of Chicanx and Latinx in the community as well as the Chicanx/Latinx population as a whole. Through our community involvement, we strongly encourage awareness of culture and heritage. Simultaneously, we emphasize the diversity that exists within the University and the community. As members, we strive to uphold these goals to the best of our abilities.

name: Multicultural Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Multicultural Research
description: The purpose of this Multicultural Research is to conduct research on multicultural topics and issues, including ethnic identity, social interaction, violence, bullying, stereotyping, and prevention and intervention programs.Â Â

name: Muslim Student Association
description: ObjectivesOur mission is to be an inclusive organization on campus--welcoming Muslims and non-Muslims. We strive to educate about Islam, countering misconceptions about the religion, and propagate Islam with utmost clarity. We aim to cultivate an environment where Muslims can come together in a supportive manner and pursue their education, while getting closer to God.We recognize that students are at varying levels in their faith. We are welcoming to all, regardless of the extent of one's religious knowledge or determination.More objectivesÂ Furthermore, the MSA aims to:Increase Islamic Awareness on the CSUS campus.Promote unity and joint action among Muslims.Conduct religious, cultural, and social activities in the best traditions of Islam.Promote friendly relations between Muslims and non-Muslims.Take part in important events in society or be vocal about them. Islam ordained its followers to be just and stand up against injustice, whether in the civic realm or elsewhere.Team up with different entities on and off campus to address specific issues, regardless of whether it directly affects the Muslim population or notÂ  and even if there are idealogical differences with those groups, as this would be an endorsement of the cause and not necessarily the group.Endeavor to make Islamic teachings known to interested non-Muslims.Help Muslim students at CSUS to achieve their educational goals in an Islamic environment during their stay at the university.Encourage active Muslim and Non-Muslim membership.

name: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) on Campus
description: The purpose of this organization is: -NAMI on Campus clubs are student-led clubs that tackle mental health issues on campus by raising mental health awareness, educating the campus community, supporting students, promoting services and supports and advocating. These clubs are open to all students, whether they live with a mental health condition, are a family member or friend or have an interest in mental health. NAMI on Campus clubs aim to address the mental health needs of all students so they have positive, successful and rewarding college experiences. -NAMI, the National Alliance on Mental Illness, is the nation's largest grassroots mental health organization dedicated to building better lives for the millions of Americans affected by mental illness. NAMI advocates for access to services, treatment, supports and research and is steadfast in its commitment to raising awareness and building a community of hope for all those in need. NAMI California is the NAMI State Organization. This Constitution governs the activities of the organization specific to CSUS. -NAMI on Campus at California State University Sacramento shall endeavor to sponsor and conduct programs and activities that further the purposes and objectives of NAMI, and shall use its best efforts to ensure that such programs and activities are consistent with NAMI's stated values and mission.

name: National Association for Music Education Collegiate
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide meaningful professional development opportunities to music educators, and to advocate for equitable access to music education within the Sacramento region and overall educational community.

name: National Pan-Hellenic Council
description: To create and maintain high standards in the life and ideas of fraternities and sororities. To perpetuate constructive fraternity and sorority relationships. To foster an understanding of the structure and method of operation among the affiliate organizations. To provide leadership training for its constituents.

name: National Society of Black Engineers
description: The mission of the National Society of Black Engineers is to Increase the number of culturally responsible black engineers who succeed professionally and positively impact the community. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: National Society of Leadership and Success
