description: The organization has been established to create a support group that will help college students achieve their goals and better their lives, in the process building leaders who make a better world. Created for the purpose of assisting college students in creating the lives they desire, by helping students discover their passion and purpose through giving them the support and tools to achieve their goals, in order to build leaders who make a better world.

name: National Student Speech Language Hearing Association
description: The National Student Speech Language and Hearing Association (NSSLHA) Chapter at California State University, Sacramento, is a pre-professional organization open to undergraduate, post-bachelor, and graduate students in the field of, or with an interest in, Communication Sciences and Disorders. NSSLHA members at Sac State are involved in social activities, educational seminars, and fundraising events within our community. We support our local on-campus Speech clinic and the NSSLHA Loves Campaign with a portion of our proceeds. We hold an annual conference attended by students and professionals seeking to expand their knowledge in Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology.

name: Natural Sciences & Mathematics Research Club
description: The purpose of the Natural Sciences & Mathematics Research Club is to promote and facilitate research opportunities for students across all disciplines, particularly in the natural sciences. Research experience is vital for students pursuing post-grad studies, including medical school and dental schools, as well as various scientific careers.

name: Newman Catholic Club
description: Â The purpose of this organization is to encourage young adult college students to seek a deeper relationship with Jesus Christ and to embrace an active, adult faith through formation grounded in the Catholic tradition.

name: Nigerian Student Association
description: The purpose of this organization is the Nigerian Student Association at Sac State is a club that wishes the development of cultural unity amongst the Nigerian community at Sac State. Keep in mind YOU DO NOT HAVE TO BE NIGERIAN TO JOIN; Join this club to engage in exciting activities, experience the amazing culture of. Nigeria, and network with other NSA clubs across the nation. It will be an experience you don't want to miss out on!

name: Nu Alpha Kappa
description: We, NU ALPHA KAPPA Fraternity, Inc. seek to unite and involve all students in a more harmonious and brotherly atmosphere through academic, social and cultural means. There is a need to interface the various backgrounds that constitute the student body of Sacramento County and surrounding areas. Nu Alpha Kappa is a Latino based fraternity, which encompasses and values all cultures.

name: Office of Graduate Studies
description: Membership Benefits

name: Office of the President
description: Membership Benefits

name: Orientation Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to mirror the standards of New Student Orientation by serving as campus leaders, advocates and resources to new students. We wish to outline and support the University's academic requirements as well as social/developmental opportunities.

name: Pacific Islanders United
description: We are a student organization that focuses its agenda on Pacific Islander culture by educating the campus community and surroundings about the different beautiful cultures and traditions within the Pacific Islander community. Our goal is to provide a space on campus for students to create community with one another while helping them preserve, embrace and become aware of their cultural identities. We are here to provide resources and community for our Pacific Islander students so that they have the necessary tools to succeed in Academia.

name: Pakistani Student Association
description: To familiarize Pakistani students with Sacramento State while introducing the campus to the Pakistani culture and building a community on campus.

name: Panhellenic Sorority Council
description: The object of the PSC shall be to develop and maintain womens fraternity life and interfraternity relations at a high level of accomplishment and in so doing to: Consider the goals and ideals of member groups as continually applicable to Campus and personal life. Promote superior scholarship and basic intellectual development. Cooperate with member womens fraternities and the university/college administration in concern for and maintenance of high social and moral standards. Act in accordance with National Panhellenic Council (NPC) Unanimous Agreements, policies and best practices. Act in accordance with such rules established by the PSC as to not violate the sovereignty, rights, and privileges of member womens fraternities. Promote the opportunity for diversity among womens fraternities at California State University, Sacramento, further referred to in this document as Sac State.

name: Peak Adventures
description: Membership Benefits

name: Phi Alpha Delta (Law Fraternity International)
description: The purpose of this organization is to form a strong bond uniting students and teachers of the law with members of the Bench and Bar in a fraternal fellowship designed to advance the ideals of liberty and equal justice under law; to stimulate excellence in scholarship; to inspire the virtues of compassion and courage; to foster integrity and professional competence; to promote the welfare of its members; and to encourage their moral, intellectual, and cultural advancement; so that each member may enjoy a lifetime of honorable professional and public service.

name: Phi Alpha Theta History Honor Society, Rho-Xi Chapter
description: The purpose of this organization is to encourage the study of history and recognize excellence in history. Facilitate student transitions into the workforce, and generate a sense of department community through organizing events and encouraging college and lifelong learning and teaching.

name: Phi Beta Sigma
description: The purpose of this organization is its dedication to strong bonds of brotherhood, living with integrity, serving humanity, promoting quality education and developing leaders.

name: Phi Mu
description: The purpose of the Eta Rho Chapter shall be to encourage and promote the purpose and ideals of Phi Mu Fraternity to this campus, and to function by the rules in the Fraternityâ€™s Constitution and Bylaws and Standing Rules and Procedures. Our mission statement is: Founded in 1852, Phi Mu is a women's organization which provides personal and academic development, service to others, commitment to excellence and lifelong friendship through a shared tradition. Phi Mu promotes vibrant living, encouraging members to achieve their personal best.

name: Phi Sigma Sigma
description: The purpose of this chapter shall be to promote friendship and cooperation amongcollegiate women of all races, creeds, and religions, to raise the standard of academic ideals, andto promote philanthropic endeavors.

name: Photography Club
description: The mission of a photography club is to foster a vibrant community of enthusiasts who share a passion for capturing and celebrating the world through the lens. The club aims to provide a supportive environment where members, regardless of skill level, can learn, grow, and express their artistic visions. By organizing workshops, critiques, and guest lectures, the club encourages skill development and creative exploration. Additionally, the club seeks to promote collaboration and networking among photographers, allowing members to share knowledge, techniques, and experiences. Through group outings and themed challenges, participants can hone their skills in diverse settings while discovering new perspectives and styles. Ultimately, the mission of the photography club is to inspire creativity, build lasting friendships, and cultivate a deeper understanding of the power of visual storytelling, all while celebrating the beauty of our shared world.

name: Pi Kappa Phi
description: The name of this subordinate chapter shall be the Epsilon Nu Associate Chapter of Pi Kappa Phi Fraternity, located at Sacramento State University. The objects of this chapter shall be the same as those set forth in the Constitution of Pi Kappa Phi Fraternity.

name: Pilipino Students of Art and Culture
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote and showcase the Pilipino American culture and history through performing arts by means of a cultural celebration by the name of Pilipino Cultural Night (PCN). PCN uses traditional dance, song, and drama centered around a script to convey contemporary issues in the Pilipino American community. PSAC collaborates with other Pilipino American Organizations on campus.

name: Planned Parenthood Generation Action
description: The purpose of this organization is to serve as a college chapter under Planned Parenthood Advocates Mar Monte and Planned Parenthood Federation of America. Planned Parenthood Generation Action at Sac State aims to: organize events to educate and mobilize the student body on issues affecting sexual health and reproductive rights, connect students to local Planned Parenthood health centers, and serve as a pro Planned Parenthood presence on campus.Planned Parenthood Generation Action, believes in the fundamental right of every individual to manage their health. PPGA supports full access to comprehensive reproductive and complementary health care services in settings that preserve and protect the essential privacy and rights of each individual; advocates public policies that guarantee these rights and ensure access to such services; supports access to medically accurate educational programs that enhance understanding of human sexuality.

name: Pre-Dental Association
description: The Pre-Dental Association at the California State University, Sacramento, is a student-run organization that strives to provide for students who are interested in Dental Assisting, Pre-Hygiene (RDH) and Pre-Dental (DDS/DMD) with valuable information and resources about the dental field which may aid them in acceptance to dental school.

name: Pre-Optometry Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to prepare students at California State University, Sacramento for admittance to colleges of optometry and familiarize students with the field. We will inform members of application process and provide guidance on requirements for optometry school. Throughout the semester, we will host aÂ variety of guest speakers. Members will be able to visit colleges of optometry through field trips. We will also work towards having events on campus promoting eye health. Volunteer and internship opportunities will be facilitated in order to provide club members with more hands-on experience within the field of optometry.

name: Pre-Physical Therapy Organization
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide members with information about becoming a licensed physcial therapist and help them become competative candidates for admission into graduate level physical therapy schools .

name: Pre-Physician Assistant Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to inform and educate students about a possible future career as a Physician Assistant. We will also provide resources and opportunities for our fellow peers to be successful in pursuing their dreams in this growing field.

name: Precast/Prestressed Concrete Institute Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to explore the possibilities of reinforced concrete structures and to provide students with the opportunity to apply their in-class knowledge directly with industry through the design, fabrication, and construction of a pre-cast/pre-stressed concrete beam. The "Big Beam" competition is hosted on a national level and allows students an amazing opportunity to showcase their knowledge, teamwork skills, structural engineering, and construction management talents. Additionally, as a returning member/officer to the club, be given the opportunity to attend the PCI National Convention hosted annually with the possibility to compete in Project Precast.

name: PRIDE Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Print Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to increase interest in the printmaking department, provide educational experiences, and raise awareness of the printmaking focus.

name: Project Rebound
description: Membership Benefits

name: Psi Chi International Honor Society in Psychology
description: The purpose of Psi Chi shall be to encourage, stimulate, and maintain excellence in scholarship of the individual members in all fields, particularly in psychology, and to advance the science of psychology.

name: Psychology Society
description: The purpose of Psychology Society shall be to improve the University and local community through community service projects as well as to enhance the education and social experience of Psychology Society members.

name: Public Health Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to supplement the academic, professional and community development of students interested in public health and health science through guest speakers, on-and-off campus events, activities, and other avenues.Â  To perform as both an informant and a source of information for greater awareness of the many aspects of public health and health science studies offered to the campus community.  To assist and disseminate information about paid and unpaid opportunities, internships and experiences related to the public health field (as well as related disciplines) by developing a network between community organizations, professionals in the field and students. To provide and connect members with social interactions through collaborations, events, and activities with related on-and-off campus entities.Â

name: Public Relations Student Society of America
description: Section 1- To serve its members by enhancing their knowledge of public relations and providing access to professional development.ection 2- To serve the public relations profession by helping to develop highly qualified, well-prepared future professionals.Section 3- Engage students with businesses and government agencies in the greater Sacramento region, California, and the United States to increase program visibility and benefit the community at large.Section 4- Prepare students with skill sets that can be immediately applied to the private sector, government, and nonprofit work environments.

name: R.A.I.N.B.O.W. Organization
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide an open and safe environment to speak freely on topics about equality and intersectionality in the field of speech pathology and audiology. Additionally, we hope to supply informative, real-life support to undergraduate, second bachelor degree (CSAD2B), and graduate students of all identities, primarily students of color, in a way that allows for a strong collective voice within the CSAD Department.

name: Read and Relax Book Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to enrich your reading experience and make new friends through the art of reading. Give you a reason and a way to relax in the company of like-minded individuals.

name: Recreation Majors Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to network with professionals within the field, to help the community through a variety of volunteer activities and to build relationships with other students.

name: Residence Hall Association
description: RHA is a governing body that will serve as a community-wide voice and promote the quality of life for all students residing in residence halls, in affiliation with California State University, Sacramento Housing and Residential Life.

name: Rock Climbing
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote friendship, learning, leadership, and teamworkthrough the sport of rock climbing, both recreationally and competitively.

name: Rowing Club
description: The purpose of this organization shall be to promote the general sport of rowing.Â

name: Royal Sting
description: A collegiate branch of Court of the Great Northwest Imperial Empire (CGNIE) The United Court of Sacramento, Redding, Chico , Stockton that strives to bring students of the LGBTQIA+ communities and allies together through inclusive mentorship, community building, philanthropic fundraising, pageantry, and fun.

name: Sac Bhangra
description: At Sac Bhangra, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and welcoming environment where everyone can join in the joy of dance. Through our shared passion for Bhangra, we aim to build a fun, conflict-free community that celebrates culture, spreads positivity, and strengthens connections through the art of dance.

name: Sac Giddha
description: The purpose of this organization is to celebrate and promote the rich cultural heritage of Punjab through the vibrant and traditional dance of Sac Giddha. We aim to foster a sense of community, pride, and artistic expression among our members, while striving for excellence in performances and competitions. Our focus is on refining our skills to participate in campus performances, where we proudly participate in showcases and represent our culture. By embracing the competitive spirit, we strive to achieve excellence while sharing the joy and beauty of Sac Giddha with diverse audiences.

name: Sac Modern Dance
description: to provide a safe space where people can grow as humans and dancers, express themselves through this art, & inspire others

name: Sac Punjabi's
description: We strive to spread awareness of the Punjabi community throughout Sac State. Members will be able to connect with one another and learn through various events such as active discussions and social gatherings.

name: Salsa Loca
description: We are Salsa Loca at Sac State .We are a non-for-profit club/organization on campus providing free dance lessons once a week. Â Our goal is to provide a safe welcoming environment where students and community members can relieve stress, anxiety, and improve their mental health and overall wellness through the expression of dancing latin music. We want to help inspire people to feel comfortable with themselves and improve their confidence, as well as teaching them about different Latin cultures.Â

name: Samahang Pilipino
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide its members with the opportunity to actively participate and contribute to the learning of the Filipino culture; the opportunity to acquire and apply leadership skills within the club, the campus, and the community at large; a setting where networking is available for people with similar interests; and the ability to work with the community through volunteering and service activities.

name: Sanskruti Indian Cultural Group
description: The purpose of this organization is to celebrate and increase awareness of rich Indian culture. The name of the organization is derived from the Sanskrit language meaning culture. The club organizes various events including two festivals: Navratri and Dhuleti. Navratri, the festival of nine nights is a festival held in honour of the divine feminine. It includes dance performance in the form of Garba. Dhuleti is a festival of colors

name: School Psychology Association
description: The purpose of this organization shall be to foster intellectual growth, encourage professional and social networking, and promote the field of school psychology.

name: Secular Student Alliance
description: The purpose of this organization is to connect students interested in and to promote secularism and humanistic values.

name: Serna Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Sigma Alpha Epsilon
description: The mission of the California Xi Chapter of the Sigma Alpha Epsilon Fraternity is: To conduct ourselves as True Gentleman in all our endeavors, as set forth by our creed. To be loyal by keeping the interests of our brothers and chapter in front of our individual wants and by holding the Fraternity above all other organizations when possible. To hold a high academic standard for the entire chapter by maintaining the highest possible grade point average (minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA). To demonstrate leadership and community outreach, not only within the University but also beyond the walls of our school by affecting the greater Sacramento community in a positive way.

name: Sigma Delta Alpha
description: To support each other academically, socially, and personally. To encourage the promotion and retention of all underrepresented groups at institutions of higher learning. To work with other organizations and our community. To promote all underrepresented cultures to the community. To conduct ourselves to cast a positive light upon the Fraternity, ourselves, and our community.

name: Sigma Delta Pi
description: To honor those students who achieve excellence in the study of the Spanish language and the culture of the Spanish-speaking peoples.

name: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc
description: The purpose of Xi Epsilon Chapter is to enhance the quality of life within the community. Public service, leadership development and education of youth are the hallmark of the organization's programs and activities. Xi Epsilon Chapter addresses concerns that impact society educationally, civically and economically.

name: Sigma Kappa
description: Sigma Kappa initiated members and new members have a responsibility to the sorority and should protect its reputation.Â Initiation into Sigma Kappa grants each member with an honor and responsibility. Each member must keep in mind the vows taken at initiation and strive to be faithful to those vows.Â Members of Sigma Kappa have an obligation to the national organization, sorority chapter, university, community, fellow members, and herself. It proudly denotes one who is spiritually sincere, morally conscious, and financially responsible.Â As Sigma Kappa women, we are responsible for representing our chapterâ€™s values and high ideals for achievement, as well as that of our neighbors, friends, family, and community. Good manners and proper behavior are essential in a sorority and everyday interaction.

name: Sigma Omega Nu
description: The purpose of this sorority shall be to strive for sisterhood, scholastic excellence, self-improvement, and Latina awareness and provide community service on the University Campus of every corresponding Chapter, as well as in the community.

name: Sigma Omega Phi
description: Sigma Omega Phi Multicultural Sorority Inc. manifested its roots on April 26, 1990 at CSU Chico campus. Sigma Omega Phi believes in opening minds through culture, education, and unity. The Gamma Chapter was established at Sacramento State University on April 20, 2012. Due to the hard work and dedication of 5 sophisticated ladies, the Gamma Chapter has evolved. With an everlasting bond and morals formulated to withstand all obstacles, the sisters pride themselves on being the Sophisticated Few. Our Gamma Chapter has and continues to uphold to the values of education, community service, and sisterhood.

name: Sigma Omicron Pi
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote lifelong friendships, unity, leadershipÂ training, and community service. Its emphasis is to foster and encourageÂ Asian-American awareness.

name: Sigma Phi Epsilon
description: The objectives of this organization are: to uphold, develop and strengthen the character of its members. To encourage those principles which are essential in the discharge of the duties which naturally evolve upon an individual as a member of society. To impress upon its members the true significance of fraternal relationships and balanced man ideals. To aid and sustain, as far as possible, the government and discipline of California State University, Sacramento. To promote scholarship. To uphold and follow the Standards code. To uphold the cardinal principles of Virtue, Diligence, and Brotherly Love.

name: Sigma Pi
description: The objects of the Fraternity shall be specifically: (a) To establish a brotherhood among students, and men of learning, who are connected with the institutions of higher education. (b) To establish and maintain an aristocracy of learning, consisting of the ablest men in all fields of study. (c) To raise the standards of morality and develop the character of men. (d) To diffuse culture and encourage chivalry among men. (e) To promote the spirit of civic righteousness and quicken the national conscience to the end that only men of character, integrity, and efficiency shall be elected or appointed to positions of honor and responsibility.

name: Sigma Pi Alpha
description: The letters we wear represent our sisterhood, our commitment to each other, and to our goals. For ourselves we are a sisterhood of academic and personal support, trust, and understanding; For our campus we sponsor informative and social activities. We support our fellow Raza organizations and network with other campus resources and groups; For our community our priority is to promote higher education through mentoring, tutoring, scholarships and to overall support Chicana/Latina youth. However, we address other community issues as well.Â

name: Sigma Theta Psi
description: The purpose of the Corporation is to form a relationship amongst a group of individuals who will carry on a lifetime friendship with each other. They will create a special bond and learn to grow spiritually. This Corporation will serve as a support group, educationally and emotionally. In addition, it will provide social and community involvement opportunities for the group.

name: Sikh Student Association
description: Sikh Student Association is an organization at California State University, Sacramento oriented to unite anyone that is interesting in learning and/or advancing their knowledge of Sikhi. The members will be able to connect with one another and learn through various events such as active discussions, social gatherings, and kirtan nights.

name: Ski & Snowboard Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote ski and snowboard safety, provide opportunities for students to experience snowboarding and skiing at the most fulfilling level and to bring together individuals of the college community in a club for social and recreational activities.

name: Ski and Snowboard Team
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide the opportunity for students to learn, improve, and master collegiate-level winter sports. Our program is dedicated to creating an environment that promotes friendly competition, an active lifestyle, and long-lasting friendships while developing our skills as competitive athletes.

name: Social Sciences and Interdisciplinary Joint Council
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a voice for the students of the College of Social Sciences and interdisciplinary Studies (SSIS) and to extend communication between the students of SSIS, SSIS organizations, SSIS faculty, staff, and administration and Associated Students Incorporated.

name: Social Work Student Association
description: The SWSA is dedicated to making a difference in the lives of others as well as our members. We strive as a group to bring a strong awareness to social work, and the opportunities it offers, through dedication, compassion, and integrity. We also seek to provide information and resources that emphasize our roles and impact as future social workers. We are committed to bringing together our peers, our professors, and individuals from our community to promote health and wellness, family, friends, diversity, equality, and many other values that social work has to offer. 2.The SWSA is committed to:a  Representing the core values and ethical principles of the social work profession, the Counsel on Social Work Education, and the National Association of Social Workers Code of Ethics b. Advocating for fellow social work students, our campus community, and our surrounding professional communities to meet professional, student, and client needs. c. Embracing the full diversity of race, creed, national origin, gender, culture, class, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, and ability, which make up our student body.

name: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics Student Chapter
description: The purpose of this organization is to further the application of mathematics to industry and science; To promote basic research in mathematics leading to new methods and techniques useful to industry and science; To provide media for the exchange of information and ideas between mathematicians and other technical and scientific personnel. Purposes of the Chapter shall be consistent with the objectives of SIAM. To provide opportunities for student forums and presentations. To promote interdisciplinary collaboration and interaction among students from applied mathematics, engineering, economics, and other related fields. To promote networking events to discuss career opportunities in applied mathematics

name: Society for the Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans in Science Chapter
description: To further the work of, to improve the effectiveness of, and to enhance the public understanding of and appreciation for Chicanos, Latinos, Native Americans, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians and other underrepresented minorities in science;2. To cooperate with other individuals, organizations, clubs, and other groups whose purposes include the achievement of public understanding for Chicanos, Latinos, Native Americans, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians and other underrepresented minorities in the sciences;3. To promote student recruitment and retention of Chicanos, Latinos, Native Americans, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians and other underrepresented minorities in science at California State University, Sacramento; and 4. To provide a forum for students from different science majors and science related majors to come together for academic, community service and social activities at California State University, Sacramento All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers
description: To prepare Asian heritage scientists, engineers, and technologists for success in the global business world, to celebrate diversity on campuses and in the workplace, and to provide opportunities for members to make contributions to their local communities. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
description: Promote professional development among our members in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM). Reveal members full potential and provide opportunities to develop their leadership skills. Achieve academic excellence and retention among members. Unify and sustain the chapter through recruitment, retainment, fundraising, networking, and post-graduation success.Inspire Hispanic youth to pursue higher education through awareness, access, and support in STEM. Reciprocate the abundant support from the scholastic, local, and Hispanic communities. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Society of Manufacturing Engineers
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a gateway for people from every major to access the machine shop and learn skills for manufacturing including but not limited to 3D Printing, CNC machining, manual machining, CAD software, welding, composites, and soldering through our meetings and workshops. We also provide excellent opportunities for networking, designing, and manufacturing projects, and meeting potential employers.

name: Society of Physics Students
description: The purpose of the Society of Physics Students (SPS) at California State University Sacramento, as a chapter of the Society of Physics Students (National), which falls under the umbrella organization of the American Institute of Physics, is to offer students a comprehensive platform for personal and professional development within the field of physics. While coursework provides a foundational understanding of physics, the SPS recognizes that a broader skill set is essential for students to flourish professionally. These chapters aim to foster these critical skills, including effective communication, leadership experience, and the establishment of personal networks. SPS provides students with opportunities to engage with professionals and peers, promoting education, collaboration, and networking within the local physics community and on a broader scale, encompassing research facilities, industry partners, and professionals worldwide. It serves as a hub for presenting scholarly work in professional meetings and journals, enabling students to gain valuable experience contributing to the scientific community. Furthermore, it actively engages in outreach services to the campus and local communities, sharing the wonders of physics and promoting science literacy. In addition, SPS organizes social and academic field trips. These field trips further enhance the educational and social aspects of the SPS experience. Beyond the local level, SPS offers students the opportunity for enrichment experiences that span regional, national, and international boundaries. These experiences broaden students' perspectives and expose them to various facets of the physics community. In essence, the SPS at California State University Sacramento, in alignment with the broader SPS mission, is dedicated to helping students transform into well-rounded, contributing members of the professional physics community by providing a comprehensive and enriching educational experience both inside and outside the classroom, and by facilitating collaboration and engagement.

name: Society of Women Engineers
description: The purpose of this organization is to further the objectives of SWE by empowering individuals committed to the mission to achieve their full potential as engineers and leaders, promoting the engineering profession as a positive force for improving the quality of life, and demonstrating the value of diversity.

name: Sociology Club
description: The purpose of this club is to give Sociology majors, and all those interested in the subject, the opportunity to learn about career and graduate school options within the field. In addition, Sociology Club members will have the opportunity to socialize and build professional connections with those who express similar interests, as well as volunteer together for the betterment of the greater Sacramento community.

name: Softball Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to bring together women interested in playing softball at a competitive level outside of NCAA

name: Soran Bushi
description: The purpose of this organization isÂ to increase awareness of Japanese cultural dances at California State University, Sacramento and foster a stronger community between Japanese and American students on campus.

name: South and Central Asian Student Association
description: Advocating for underrepresented South and Central Asian students on campus and promoting awareness of their presence. Additionally, we want to create learning environments for everyone through events. The club would be education-based (history), and teach individuals.

name: Southwest Asian & North African (SWANA) Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Stingerettes
description: To inspire confidence, strength, and empowerment through the art of dance. We are dedicated to performing at our highest level, continuously striving for excellence, and expressing ourselves fully through movement. Our core values include confidence and fierceness (embodied in our concept of "sass"), teamwork, integrity, precision, and personal growth.

name: Street Dance Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a space for people to share and practice their knowledge of street dance culture.

name: Student Academy of Audiology
description: The purpose of this organization is to serve as a collective voice for students and advance the rights, interests, and welfare of students pursuing careers in audiology. The SAA introduces students to lifelong involvement in activities that promote and advance the profession of audiology and provides services, information, education, representation, and advocacy for the profession, the students, and the public we serve.

name: Student Affairs
description: Membership Benefits

name: Student Affairs IT
description: Membership Benefits

name: Student Alumni Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to forge lifelong connections through distinctive student experiences and alumni engagement.

name: Student Association for Applied Behavior Analysis
description: The mission of the Student Association for Applied Behavior Analysis (SAABA) is to promote the study of Applied Behavior Analysis by providing its members with the opportunity to learn more about the career and research opportunities in the field through social networking, workshops, conferences and guest lecturer events.

name: Student Association For Industrial-Organizational Psychology (I-O)
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide students interested in Industrial-Organizational Psychology, Workplace Psychology, or related fields with information about I-O psychology, career and educational opportunities, and networking through club events.

name: Student Association of Laboratory Scientists
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide students in the laboratory sciences with job information and contacts, internship opportunities, and graduate program information.

name: Student Bible Study Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide a welcoming space for students of all backgrounds to meet weekly and engage in open, thoughtful dialogue on a portion of the Bible. Through group discussion and shared exploration, the club looks to deepen understanding of the Biblical story, have respectful conversations, and promote personal reflection. The club has no specific religious affiliation – all are welcome.

name: Student Counseling Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote professionalism and excellence in the counseling profession, build connections, and serve as a support group for students interested in the fields of counseling

name: Student Economics Association
description: The purpose of the Student Economics Association (SEA) shall be to further the interests of all students interested in economics through the promotion of scholarship, the development of student leaders who are committed to service within their community, and the cultivation of fellowship among students, faculty and staff at Sacramento State.

name: Student Fashion Association
description: The Student Fashion Association is an organization that strives to be more involved in the Fashion Industry. Our organization gives opportunities that can lead to bigger dreams and goals, with your involvement and participation. We work closely with local designers from Sacramento and events like Sacramento Fashion Week and networking with many industry professionals. SFA comes together as a group of hard-working students to create strong bonds, career opportunities, learn more about the industry in itself, and explore the world of fashion.

name: Student Health, Counseling, and Wellness Services
description: Membership Benefits

name: Student Interprofessional Education
description: The purpose of this organization is to socialize, network, and discuss/learn about current healthcare topics aiming to provide collaborative patient-centered care and promote the triple aim of health care: Enhance patient experience, improve the health of the community, and reduce the cost of health care.

name: Student Investment Fund Club
description: The purpose of this organization is a group of students (all majors welcome) interested in learning more about Student Investment Fund management and furthering their knowledge in the field. Student Investment Fund Club is the community that fosters the value of Student Investment Fund Management and advances the practice and profession of investment management. Other purposes of the Student Chapter are to give students the opportunity to learn about investment management, have exposure to financial professionals, obtain internships and employment opportunities and develop interpersonal and leadership skills.

name: Student Organizations and Leadership
description: Student Organizations & Leadership (SO&L) advocates for students and contributes to learning, development, and retention by providing opportunities for involvement, leadership, and empowerment through a wide variety of organizations and programs. These experiences nurture campus pride and student success to advance an inclusive and equitable community.

name: Student Parent Scholars United
description: The purpose of this organization to bring student-parents on campus together and create a village while also advocating for and bringing awareness to our unique population.

name: Students for Justice in Palestine
description: The purpose of this organization is to bring awareness and activism for the occupation in Palestine. We are an advocacy group of students, faculty, and community members at CSU Sacramento devoted to the liberation of Palestine with a one state solution, promoting justice, human rights, and a call to an end of its illegal occupation. We bring awareness of the occupation and apartheid by Israel against indigenous Palestinians though protests, memorials, vigils, educational events, and actions to provide visualization of the Palestinian struggle. We serve with the goal of highlighting the Palestinian narrative in their fight for self-determination and full decolonization

name: Swim Club
description: The purpose of this club would be to bring together people who enjoy swimming and get some exercise. All levels are welcome and we will have fun and train.

name: Symphonic Wind Ensemble
description: The purpose of this organization is to enrich the musical experiences of instrumental performers at Sacramento State through the instruction of wind band literature.

name: Symphony Orchestra
description: The purpose of this organization is to enrich the musical experiences of instrumental performers at Sacramento State through the instruction of orchestral literature.

name: Tabletop Activities and Gaming
description: The purpose of this organization is to create and serve a tabletop gaming community on campus; allowing students to interact and enjoy gaming activities with their peers. We aspire to create an environment that will allow creativity to flourish through the use of workshops and discussions surrounding the numerous tabletop hobbies the club will represent. As well as host events for the recreation of the student body .

name: Tau Beta Pi - CA-U
description: To mark in a fitting manner those who have conferred honor upon their Alma Mater by distinguished scholarship and exemplary character as students in engineering, or by their attainments as alumni in the field of engineering.

name: Tau Kappa Epsilon
description: To aid men in their mental, moral and social development for life. To contribute to the advancement of society through the personal growth of our members and their service to others. To create lifelong relationships that enhance educational, interpersonal, community and professional success.

name: Tennis Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to introduce an athletic social group to participate and play tennis, to compete in the Tennis On Campus League, to meet new people, to improve our tennis skills, and to have fun doing so.

name: The Beavers
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide an awareness of the Heavy Civil Construction Industry. We are committed to introduce individuals from all grade levels into the Heavy Civil world of construction

name: The Belonging Collective
description: The Belonging Collective provides a space where multicultural students can embrace their emerging adult identities. This space fosters a sense of belonging through the exploration of students’ intersecting identities (e.g. ethnicity, race, gender, sexuality, etc.) within the context of the world around them. Our club supports the academic, professional, and personal success of students as they navigate the challenges and opportunities of college.

name: The Black Student-Athlete Alliance
description: The purpose of this organization is to create a welcoming, inclusive and supportive community in which our main mission is to amplify our voices, share our unique experiences, and foster a thriving sense of community that celebrates our achievements and resilience. We are committed to excelling both in competition as well as in the classroom. We strive for excellence, recognizing that our journeys extend beyond sports. We aim to inspire future generations, advocate for equity, and create a legacy of academic and athletic success that uplifts our communities and showcases the power of our diverse narratives. Together, we will champion our aspirations and the collective strength of our identities. All students regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: The Elohist
description: To share the Love of Heavenly Mother to all.

name: The French Connections
description: Are you a Francophile? If you are interested in learning and discovering more about the French language through its cultures and histories... Yes, you are! The French Connections is the place to learn, meet people, and immerse yourself in a dynamic network of French speakers who are passionate about promoting and celebrating all of our beautiful and more diverse than you can imagine Francophone cultures! Through this unique Sac State inclusive and open to all community, join us in cultural celebrations, conversation practice, networking or guest speaker events, and so much more! Thinking about joining? Or just want to make sure that you never miss any news from the club? Don't hesitate to contact us by sending an email at thefrenchconnectionscsus@gmail.com and let us know your interest !Au plaisir de vous revoir bientot!

name: The Hive
description: The purpose of The Hive is to develop the ideas of individuals and foster entrepreneurial growth and action.

name: The Hive Collective
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide students with the opportunity to develop the technical, collaboration, and marketing skills with the purpose to creating production ready applications that solves real-world problems. The club will foster social connection by integrating respect and understanding through sharing common goals such as possible revenue generation and social good through the development of these applications. This club is open to all students, ideally for those who are motivated in creating new products and solving problems.

name: The Hornet Journalism Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to foster journalism success for students throughout the Sacramento region. The club will coordinate and network with local high school and community college journalism programs to uplift student voices and encourage students to succeed in the journalism world.

name: The Navigators
description: The mission of the Navigators, a missions organization, is to help individuals “To Know Christ, make Him known, and help others do the same”. In the collegiate branch, we are aiming to help college students learn who Jesus is and what He was about. We also offer one-to-one spiritual mentorship to help students be equipped and confident in sharing who Jesus is to others in their current collegiate context and also in their post grad contexts.

name: The Social  and Emotional Learning Project
description: The purpose of this organization is to focus on community service within the Sacramento Unified School District geared towards social and emotional learning competencies, such as responsible decision-making, self-management, self-awareness, social awareness, and healthy relationship skills.

name: The University Union
description: Membership Benefits

name: The WELL
description: Membership Benefits

name: Transportation Challenge
description: Develop transportation engineering deliverables for submission to the annual ASCE Mid - Pacific Student Conference

name: Turning Point USA
description: Turning Point USA's mission is to educate students about the importance of fiscal responsibility, free markets, and capitalism through innovative campus activism and non-partisan, thought-provoking discussion

name: United Sorority and Fraternity Council
description: The purpose of the USFC shall be to assist culturally diverse sororities and fraternities in the achievement of their noble purposes and to provide a forum for the regulation of organization interactions.  The USFC shall act as a liaison between our member organizations and the university administration by establishing a communicative network for all culturally diverse sororities and fraternities to promote unity amongst the organizations and the university community.Â

name: Vertical Flight Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide student engagement in academic and professional activities that promote vertical flight research through networking, project-based support, and involvement in an international organization (VFS) that advances the theory and practices of the science of vertical flight vehicles. The VFS Student Chapter will encourage and support participation in international rotorcraft design competitions and VFS-sponsored events and scholarships.

name: Veterans Club
description: The purpose of this organization is Organize fellowship activities for veterans and other members, provide assistance for students transitioning from military service to the educational experience, advance interests common to the campus veteran community, increase awareness of veteran life to interested non-veteran members, and offer support for veterans who may be having difficulty coping with past traumatic military experiences.

name: Veterans Success Center
description: Membership Benefits

name: Video Game Design Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to be a dynamic and inclusive space for individuals interested in exploring the multifaceted world of video game creation. We extend a warm welcome to all students, regardless of their skill level or academic background. Our club is designed to bring together a diverse range of talents, from programming and computer science to art, storytelling, music, and more.

name: Vietnamese Student Association
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote and embrace Vietnamese culture and history while providing a safe, welcoming community. It is of utmost importance the association promotes diversity and inclusivity, avoiding the creation of a segregated community.

name: Vocal Jazz Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote and nurture vocal jazz music of the past and present through our own Sac State Jazz Singers ensemble.

name: Voices of Diversity
description: Our club, rooted in the Psychology Department at Sac State, is dedicated to fostering a sense of community and inclusivity. Our goal is to promote spaces where peers feel they truly belong within academic settings. Our mission centers on offering tools and resources that enhance wellness, cultivate student success, and support personal growth through intentional community engagement, we want to create a sense of belonging. This initiative began with the department’s Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) efforts, and although initial funding was cut, we believe so strongly in its impact that we transitioned it into a student-led organization to provide continuity and expand its reach.

name: Water Resources and Environmental Engineering Club
description: The goal of the Water Resources and Environmental Engineering Club at California State University, Sacramento is to unite the students with interest in the Environmental Engineering discipline in order to further their networking opportunities with peers, members of the faculty and staff, and people in the industry. The specific objectives of this Chapter shall be to promote the common professional interests of its members and to further the purposes of the Chapter through not-for-profit activities, including, but not limited to, education, training, meetings, publications, and philanthropic work.

name: Water Treatment Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to develop students' interest in water treatment and how it relates to engineering. This organization forms a team of students to compete in the ASCE Mid-Pacific Water Treatment Competition every spring.

name: West Coast Stingers
description: Our mission is to grow a vibrant and inclusive community of dancers at Sacramento State, bringing together individuals of all backgrounds. We aim to inspire creativity, foster meaningful connections, and promote well-being through diverse dance styles and shared experiences. We strive to cultivate a supportive space where students can develop a passion for dance, social skills, and contribute to the dynamic culture of our campus and local community.

name: Women in Business
description: The purpose of this organization is to provide undergraduate women interested in business an opportunity to make connections in the business world, and promote their personal and professional development in order to become leaders in the business community. Anyone, regardless of sex, can participate in the group if they are committed to the mission of the group.

name: Women in Construction
description: The purpose of this organization is to support women pursuing careers and interests in the construction industry. We aim to create a lively community where people supporting women in the construction industry can connect, share knowledge, and motivate one another. Through networking, industry exposure, and professional development we strive to promote diversity, inclusion and advance the presence and influence of women in the construction field. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Women in Law
description: Our Mission is to uplift our community and help put members on a path to a successful career in law. We encourage our members to follow their legal passions and provide resources for them to succeed. We strive to provide a space for our members to learn, grow, and connect with others who share their same goals and ambitions.

name: Women in Physics and Astronomy
description: Join a diverse community of brilliant minds and fearless trailblazers. Our club provides a supportive and empowering space for women and other gender minorities pursuing their passion for physics, fostering camaraderie, mentorship, and academic excellence. Together, we will break down barriers, shatter glass ceilings, and pave the way for a future where our voices are at the forefront. Discover your potential, ignite your curiosity, and unleash your brilliance with WiPA! All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Women in STEM
description: The purpose of this organization is to unite all those who support the advancement of STEM majors and careers.

name: Women Who Lift
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote female weightlifting and empower individuals from all backgrounds to feel confident and strong in the gym. Recognizing that the gym can be an intimidating space for some, our goal is to build a supportive community. We aim to educate students on fitness and support everyone on their fitness journey, whether they are beginners or avid lifters. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Women's & Gender Studies Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to create opportunities for students of any major areas of study by extending and expanding upon the interdisciplinary areas of study within and in relation to the department of Women & Gender Studies. This includes, but is not limited to, supporting students’ multimedia and community outreach projects as they relate to the classes they are actively enrolled in, primarily those within the Women and Gender Studies major breadth and the LGBTQ Studies Minor program, as well as establishing and maintaining a strong media presence to broadcast and promote education and conversations on the CSUS campus to discuss topics of interest and relevance to our department. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Women's Basketball Club
description: The Sacramento Native Athletics women’s basketball program (SNA) aims to provide a space for student athletes @ CSUS to compete for championships, pursue athletic and academic excellence, and ultimately connect with their peers or own identity as Native American, and understand what it means to be Native in today's society. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Women's Resource Center
description: Membership Benefits The Women’s Resource Center at Sac State is a welcoming and empowering space for women-identified students to connect, grow, and thrive. By joining our community, you’ll find a supportive environment where you can openly explore topics like identity, self-worth, relationships, and body image without judgment. We offer peer-led drop-in support groups, leadership opportunities, and engaging events focused on wellness, advocacy, and education. Whether you're seeking connection, personal growth, or a chance to be part of meaningful change on campus, the WRC is here to support you. Come as you are — there’s a place for you here.

name: Women's Rugby Club
description: The Sacramento State Women's Rugby Sport Club strives to develop lifelong skills of collaboration, inclusion and unity through the sport of rugby. Our club was founded in Fall 1999 and has been a proud part of the Sacramento State Community ever since. We are a Division I Women's Collegiate team in the Pacific Mountain Rugby Conference. No experience is needed to join the club, the coaches and the members will help learn and develop skills and knowledge of the sport. All students, regardless of sex, race, color, or national origin, who are interested in the club’s mission are welcome.

name: Women's Soccer Club
description: The purpose of this organization is to promote the growth of the game of soccer in a competitive aspect. It will provide students with the opportunity to improve their soccer skills in a comfortable and respectable environment, while competing against other universities.

name: Women's Volleyball Club
description: The Sacramento State Women's Volleyball Club focuses on building athleticism, motivation, encouragement, team skills, communication, competitiveness, and responsibility. The purpose of this organization is to give students the opportunity to play volleyball at the competitive level for the University against other collegiate volleyball clubs throughout California, as well as throughout the nation.

name: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc.
description: We, a group of college women, do hereby bind ourselves together for the purpose of promoting the cause of education by encouraging the highest standard of scholarship through scientific, literary, cultural, and educational programs; promoting charitable projects on college campuses and within the community; fostering the spirit of sisterly love and promoting the ideal of Finer Womanhood.
